title: Is Facebook Banning Posts Using the Hashtag #SavetheChildren?
subtitle: The hashtag had been associated with conspiracy theories and misinformation campaigns surrounding child abuse and pedophilia sex rings.
author: Madison Dapcevich
statement: Facebook is blocking or banning posts using the hashtag #SavetheChildren.

title: Is Trump Blocking COVID-19 Aid in Favor of Tax Cuts That Would Drain Social Security?
subtitle: It wasn't the first time the president pushed to add the payroll tax cut to a coronavirus relief package.
author: Bethania Palma
statement: U.S. President Donald Trump is withholding coronavirus relief until Congress agrees to payroll tax cuts that would effectively jeopardize Social Security funding.

title: Was a Fatal Motorcycle Crash Listed Among COVID-19 Deaths in Florida?
subtitle: A case that was initially tallied among coronavirus deaths in 2020 caused some confusion.
author: Bethania Palma
statement: A motorcyclist killed in a crash in Florida in 2020 was listed as a COVID-19 death.

title: Did a Utah School Reopening Plan Include Template Letter in Case a Student Dies?
subtitle: A crisis communication plan needed its own crisis communication plan.
author: Bethania Palma
statement: A school district in Utah included a template letter to send home if a student or staff member died after reopening amid the COVID-19 pandemic.

title: Did an Oregon County Say Only White People Must Wear COVID-19 Masks?
subtitle: Oregon Gov. Kate Brown did issue an order requiring people wear masks in seven counties, including Lincoln County.
author: Jessica Lee
statement: In a policy that established requirements for people to wear masks in most public settings during the COVID-19 pandemic, Oregon's Lincoln County said in June 2020 residents of color are exempt from the rule.

title: Did Anthony Fauci Say People No Longer Need to Wear Masks?
subtitle: An old interview with Dr. Fauci made new rounds on social media during the coronavirus disease pandemic in 2020.
author: Nur Ibrahim
statement: The United States' top infectious diseases expert, Dr. Anthony Fauci, said people in the U.S. do not need to wear masks to protect against COVID-19.

title: Is Facebook Sponsoring the Republican National Convention?
subtitle: Just as with food products, it pays to check the date stamped on news articles.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: Facebook has announced they will be sponsoring the upcoming Republican National Convention.

title: Did Trump Put Rick Scott 'in Charge of Republican Healthcare'?
subtitle: A meme shared by social media users had some chronology issues.
author: Bethania Palma
statement: U.S. President Donald Trump has put Florida U.S. Sen. Rick Scott "in charge of Republican healthcare" reform.

title: Did VP Pence Touch NASA Gear Labeled 'Do Not Touch'?
subtitle: An old photo received new attention as U.S. Vice President Mike Pence took over the Trump administration's response to an outbreak of a new coronavirus.
author: Bethania Palma
statement: A photograph shows U.S. Vice President Mike Pence touching a piece of NASA equipment that bore a sign reading "DO NOT TOUCH."

title: Can Farmers Sue Monsanto Over Invasive GMO Crops?
subtitle: Timing is important in both producing and understanding the news.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: A bill before the Oregon Legislature would allow farmers to sue Monsanto if GMO crops invade their property.

title: Did a Catholic Priest Encourage Anti-Trump Protesters to Commit Suicide?
subtitle: Parishioners did not see the humor in a 2017 Facebook meme.
author: Bethania Palma
statement: A Catholic priest posted a meme encouraging anti-Trump protesters to commit suicide.

title: Were 30 Marines Just Killed in a Helicopter Crash?
subtitle: A years-old news story recirculated in the wake of another deadly helicopter crash.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Thirty Marines were just killed in a helicopter crash.

title: Is Chick-fil-A Giving Away Its Food Free for a Year?
subtitle: Always check the expiration date on social media promotions.
author: Bethania Palma
statement: Chick-fil-A is giving away free meals from the chain in 2020.

title: Was This Koala Rescued From a Bushfire in Australia?
subtitle: As wildfires raged in Australia in January 2020, a photograph from a previous blaze went viral.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A photograph shows a koala being treated after it was rescued from a bushfire in Australia.

title: Did the FDA Announce a Baby Ibuprofen Recall in December 2019?
subtitle: A West Virginia television news station reported a product recall in the final days of 2019.
author: Dan MacGuill
statement: In December 2019, the FDA reported that Tris Pharma had announced a voluntary recall of several infant ibuprofen products.

title: Was a Blind Girl in the UK Banned from Using Her Cane at School?
subtitle: The story went viral and resulted in internet outrage when it was posted.
author: Bethania Palma
statement: A school in Bristol, England, banned a blind girl from using a walking cane at the school because it could be a safety hazard.

title: Did Hacker Who 'Helped Expose' Steubenville Rape Face More Prison Time than Rapists?
subtitle: It's always messy to compare criminal cases in different jurisdictions involving varying circumstances.
author: Bethania Palma
statement: The hacker who "helped expose" the infamous Steubenville High School rape in Ohio faced more prison time than the rapists themselves.

title: Does Photo Show Newly Elected Safiyah Khalid Giving the Middle Finger?
subtitle: A misleading attack against a politician doesn't appear to have stymied her electoral efforts.
author: Bethania Palma
statement: A photograph shows newly elected Lewiston (Maine) City Councilwoman Safiyah Khalid giving the middle finger.

title: Did a Human-Created Sinkhole Open in Guatemala?
subtitle: Some news items are so fascinating that they resurface time and time again.
author: Bethania Palma
statement: A massive human-made sinkhole opened up in Guatemala.

title: Did Police Find Heroin Disguised as SweeTarts?
subtitle: The Halloween holiday may have revived interest in an outdated and unsubstantiated warning.
author: Bethania Palma
statement: Police have discovered heroin disguised as SweeTarts brand candy.

title: Were 11 People Killed, Dozens More Wounded Over One Weekend in Chicago?
subtitle: News, like food, is best consumed at the time it is prepared.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: A recent weekend of violence in Chicago left 11 people dead and dozens more wounded but attracted relatively little press coverage.

title: Did Trump Meet with 30 Men in Congress to Discuss Maternity Care?
subtitle: An image of the all-male Freedom Caucus discussing the future of women's health care coverage sparked anger.
author: Bethania Palma
statement: U.S. President Donald Trump met with 30 men in the U.S. House of Representatives' Freedom Caucus to discuss maternity care.

title: Is a U.S. Flag Improperly Displayed at a Quality Inn?
subtitle: A photograph of an improperly displayed American flag outside of a Quality Inn hotel in Iowa continues to circulate on social media, despite being several years old.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A photograph shows an improperly displayed American flag outside of a Quality Inn hotel in May 2019.

title: Did Migrants 'Invade' a Beach in Broad Daylight?
subtitle: The claim appears to reference an incident on the shores of a beach in Spain in 2017.
author: Bethania Palma
statement: Immigrants "invaded" a beach, leaving beachgoers "shocked."

title: Outdated: Beth Chapman Death Hoax
subtitle: Before she died in June 2019, the reality TV star was the subject of online rumors.
author: Alex Kasprak
statement: Beth Chapman, wife of Duane “Dog” Chapman from the reality TV show “Dog the Bounty Hunter,” died in April 2019.

title: Are Texas Legislators 'Considering the Death Penalty for Women Who Have Abortions'?
subtitle: Republican-sponsored House Bill 896 garnered nationwide attention in the spring of 2019.
author: Dan MacGuill
statement: House Bill 896, considered by the Texas House of Representatives in 2019, would have the effect of making abortion punishable by death.

title: Did Nike Just Re-Hire Michael Vick?
subtitle: Vick and Nike worked together after the former NFL star went to prison for dogfighting, but the story was already an old one when it recirculated in April 2019.
author: Dan Evon
statement: In April 2019, Nike re-hired Michael Vick, a former NFL player who served prison time for facilitating dogfighting.

title: Is Home Depot Selling Plants Treated with Bee-Harming Neonicotinoid Pesticides?
subtitle: The company pledged in 2015 to phase out the class of pesticides over concerns that they harmed bee populations.
author: Alex Kasprak
statement: Home Depot is selling plants treated with bee-harming neonicotinoid pesticides.

title: Did DoubleTree Hotels Display a Sign Denying Service to Military Members?
subtitle: "Two Supervisor-level employees, who have since been terminated, made poor decisions including displaying a sign that they created."
author: Dan Evon
statement: DoubleTree Hotels displayed a sign reading "no longer serving military personnel and their guest(s)."

title: Will 2018 See the First Christmas Full Moon Since 1977?
subtitle: Beware of memes that use relative temporal terms.
author: Dan Evon
statement: The year 2018 will see the first Christmas full moon since 1977.

title: Did Facebook 'Censor' an Image of Santa Kneeling Before Baby Jesus?
subtitle: The social media platform briefly covered a religious image that has been online for years.
author: Bethania Palma
statement: Facebook "censored" an image of Santa Claus kneeling before baby Jesus.

title: Do These 8 Teas Contain “Illegal Amounts of Deadly Pesticides”?
subtitle: Claims of dangerous pesticides “above the legal limit” in tea products rely on incorrect or misleading descriptions of out-of-date testing.
author: Alex Kasprak
statement: Testing has revealed that eight popular tea brands contain illegal amounts of deadly pesticides.

title: Has It Been 10,316 Days Since the Berlin Wall Was Torn Down?
subtitle: Everything is relative, including -- or especially -- time.
author: Dan Evon
statement: The Berlin Wall existed for 10,316 days and was torn down 10,316 days ago.

title: Does This Vet Need Help in Finding Survivors of His Air Force Bomb Group?
subtitle: The online world is amazing in satisfying some requests, but often information is propagated long beyond its useful life.
author: Alex Kasprak
statement: A photograph shows a WWII vet who is “looking for any survivors of WWII 384th Air Force Bomb Group.”

title: Terminally Ill Teen Requests Christmas Cards for the Holiday
subtitle: The late Maddox Hyde of Pennsylvania did issue a request for cards after doctors said his cancer had worsened and he had only a short time to live.
author: David Emery
statement: Fourteen-year-old, terminally ill cancer patient Maddox Hyde asked that people send him Christmas cards for the holiday.

title: Is Allisyn Nicole Still Missing?
subtitle: Recycled social media posts from 2013 report that the young woman who supposedly went missing was found.
author: David Emery
statement: A young woman named Allisyn Nicole is missing.

title: Was Manure Dumped Outside of Democratic Headquarters in Ohio?
subtitle: A photograph showing a pile of manure discovered outside a political HQ is real, but the picture is years-old.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A photograph shows a pile of manure outside of Democratic Headquarters in Warren County, Ohio, in November 2018.

title: Did Donald Trump's First Year as President See the Lowest Jobs Growth Since 2011?
subtitle: A left-wing web site's January 2018 meme was based on data that were accurate at the time, but which have since been revised.
author: Dan MacGuill
statement: In 2017, President Donald Trump's first year in office, jobs growth was the lowest it has been since 2011.

title: Did the Justice Department Demand Facebook Information for 'Anti-Trump Activists'?
subtitle: In October 2018, social media users recirculated a story about search warrants that had actually been issued more than a year earlier.
author: Arturo Garcia
statement: The Justice Department issued search warrants seeking Facebook user information connected to activist efforts against President Donald Trump.

title: Is a 'Female Blackout' Taking Place on Facebook Tomorrow?
subtitle: A chain message urging women to use a black square for their profile pics "tomorrow" has been circulating on Facebook for well over a year.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Women can partake in a social media campaign against domestic abuse by "blacking out" their Facebook profile pictures "tomorrow."

title: Did Jimmy Carter Announce That His Cancer Is Spreading?
subtitle: Viral social media posts rehashed a three-year-old announcement about the former president, who has been cancer-free since December 2015.
author: Dan MacGuill
statement: Former president Jimmy Carter has announced that the cancer in his liver has spread to other parts of his body.

title: Did a Michigan School District Ban Students from Wearing the American Flag?
subtitle: A year-old Facebook post about a school dress code became a source of reanimated outrage in 2018.
author: Bethania Palma
statement: Roseville Community Schools banned children from wearing clothing with American flag imagery.

title: Did Eleven U.S. Marines Give Their Lives This Week?
subtitle: A long-circulated message offers prayers on behalf of servicemen killed in Afghanistan several years ago.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: A long-circulated message offers prayers on behalf of eleven U.S. Marines "that gave their lives this week."

title: Did Wild Dogs Kill a Two-Year-Old Boy at a Zoo?
subtitle: A pack of wild dogs attacked and killed a two-year-old child at a Pittsburgh zoo, but that tragedy took place several years ago.
author: Bethania Palma
statement: A pack of wild dogs attacked and killed a two-year-old child at a Pittsburgh zoo.

title: Are Bush's Baked Beans Being Recalled?
subtitle: A 'zombie' recall notice from 2017 prompted by defective can seams continues to be presented as new and current.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: Cans of Bush's Baked Beans are being recalled because the cans may have defective side seams.

title: Are These the Defense Ministers of Norway, Sweden, Netherlands, Germany and Russia?
subtitle: A photograph showing four female defense ministers from Norway, Sweden, Netherlands and Germany and their male counterpart from Russia is real but outdated.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A photograph shows four female defense ministers from Norway, Sweden, Netherlands and Germany and a male defense minister from Russia.

title: Did Republicans Vote to Make It Legal to Ban Gays and Lesbians from Adopting?
subtitle: In a party line vote, the Republican majority in the House Appropriations Committee approved an amendment to a funding bill that would allow federally-funded adoption agencies to discriminate against LGBTQ families.
author: David Emery
statement: The Republican majority in the House Appropriations Committee voted to approve an amendment allowing taxpayer-funded adoption agencies to deny services to LGBTQ families.

title: Was the Golden State Fence Company Fined $5 Million for Hiring Undocumented Workers to Build a Border Wall?
subtitle: A years-old story about a construction outfit was presented as if the company were building the border wall advocated by President Trump.
author: Dan Evon
statement: The Golden State Fence Company was fined $5 million for hiring workers without documentation to build a border wall.

title: Was Obama Ranked 'Worst President Since World War II' in a New Poll?
subtitle: An outdated poll from 2014 was drastically misrepresented by a number of right-wing sites and pundits, none of whom appears to have correctly sourced the claim.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Former U.S. president Barack Obama was ranked the worst president since World War II in "a recent poll."

title: Is Congressional Candidate Nathan Larson an Admitted Pedophile?
subtitle: A Virginia congressional candidate served prison time for threatening to kill the president and holds some highly unconventional viewpoints about children and sexuality.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: Virginia congressional candidate Nathan Larson admitted that he is a pedophile.

title: Does a Nationwide Listeria Outbreak Affect Vegetables from Walmart, Safeway, and Trader Joe's?
subtitle: Web sites continue to confuse consumers with a long out-of-date warning about a listeria-related recall of packaged vegetables.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: Packaged vegetables from Mann Packing are being recalled due to concerns about listeria.

title: Was a Marine Told He Can't Fly U.S. and Marine Corps Flags at the Same Time?
subtitle: A meme circulating on social media is based on a years-old dispute over a retirement community's rules about flags.
author: Bethania Palma
statement: Marine Corps Capt. Jim Lowe was told he can't fly both an American flag and Marine Corps colors outside his home.

title: Were Students in Stockton, California Arrested During a March 2018 Gun Safety Protest?
subtitle: A "militia" group on Facebook attempted to paint local high schoolers participating in a demonstration as irresponsible.
author: Arturo Garcia
statement: High school students in Stockton, California were arrested during a gun safety demonstration.

title: Was Barack Obama Named in a Lawsuit for 'Inciting Violence' Against Police?
subtitle: A lawsuit accusing former the former United States president of inciting violence against police officers was ultimately dismissed.
author: Dan Evon
statement: President Obama is being sued for "inciting violence" against police.

title: Did Target Issue an Easter Egg Recall?
subtitle: A questionable, undated blog reported the recall as "fresh" - ignoring the fact that it was issued in 2017.
author: Arturo Garcia
statement: Target issued a recall for a line of Easter egg toys.

title: Did Apple Remove Easter from iOS Calendars?
subtitle: U.S. calendars for 2018 on Apple devices initially did not mark Easter, but the holiday has since been restored to calendar apps.
author: Dan MacGuill
statement: An iPhone operating system upgrade in 2018 removed Easter holidays from the iOS calendar application.

title: Did a Michigan State Senate Candidate Defend Men Having Sex with Underage Girls?
subtitle: A  Michigan state senate candidate said his Facebook account was hacked and a series of troubling posts were the result of an attempt to sabotage his political career.
author: Dan MacGuill
statement: A Michigan state senate candidate wrote that it was "normal" for adult men to marry and have sex with pre-pubescent girls.

title: Is this Teenager in Danger?
subtitle: A Georgia teenager's claims in a two-year-old video have long since been denied, but they continue to spread and inconvenience local police.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: Georgia teenager Maddie Kelley is endangered and needs help.

title: Is This an Airplane on Fire?
subtitle: A Facebook page purporting to post live news appears to have stolen their footage from an Instagram account.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A video shows an airplane on fire in January 2018.

title: Did Jamie Oliver Prove McDonald's Burgers Are Unfit for Human Consumption?
subtitle: An outdated controversy about McDonald's use of beef treated with ammonium hydroxide resurfaced on social media in 2018.
author: David Emery
statement: Celebrity chef Jamie Oliver proved that the meat in McDonald's hamburgers is "unfit for human consumption" due to the use of beef trimmings treated with bacteria-killing ammonium hydroxide.

title: Missing Child Alert: Heaven Ray Cox
subtitle: A mother's viral Facebook post reported that the 15-year-old girl was missing from her home in Orange, Texas.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: Texas teenager Heaven Ray Cox is missing from her Orange County home.

title: Terminally Ill Nine-Year-Old Hopes for Christmas Cards?
subtitle: The family of Jacob Thompson requested cards for the ailing child so that he could have a final celebration.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: The family of a terminally ill boy is asking people to send him Christmas cards.

title: Does Hobby Lobby Refuse to Sell Jewish Holiday Items?
subtitle: A controversy arose over a reported lack of Hanukkah items offered for sale in Hobby Lobby stores.
author: David Emery
statement: The arts and crafts chain Hobby Lobby does not sell Jewish holiday items at any of their stores.

title: Prayer Request for 30 SEALs Killed in Afghanistan
subtitle: A request for prayers for the families of 30 U.S. military personnel who died when their helicopter was shot down in Afghanistan is several years old.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: Social media post requests prayers for the families of 30 U.S. military personnel killed when their helicopter was shot down in Afghanistan.

title: Is Dunkin' Donuts Offering Free Coffee for Teachers Every Monday in September?
subtitle: A picture related to a promotion held at one Dunkin' Donuts outlet in 2014 has popped up again online every year since.
author: Arturo Garcia
statement: Dunkin' Donuts is offering free coffee to teachers every Monday in September.

title: Leftist Activists Demand New York Museum Take Down Statue of 'Racist' Theodore Roosevelt?
subtitle: Clashes with neo-Nazis in Charlottesville did not inspire "leftists" to demand the removal of a statue of Theodore Roosevelt in New York City.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: After "demanding that southern states take down statues of Confederate figures, the activist Left is now targeting" a New York City statue of President Teddy Roosevelt.

title: Did Frito-Lay Issue a Product Recall Due to Salmonella Fears?
subtitle: An April 2017 recall of Frito-Lay jalapeno-flavored products was reported as new in July and August 2017.
author: Dan MacGuill
statement: Frito-Lay issued a recall of two potato chip products in April 2017 over Salmonella-related fears, a report framed as new in July and August 2017.

title: Was Nelly Arrested on Drug Charges in April 2017?
subtitle: A 2015 news story about the musician's being detained was repackaged and recirculated as current years later.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Hip-hop and pop star Nelly was arrested on drug charges while on tour.

title: Was Sargento Brand Cheese Recalled in August or September 2017?
subtitle: Sargento is the latest victim of a "zombie recall" form of fake news, when an outdated consumer warning circulates as new long after the problem is resolved.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: Sargento cheese was recalled on 9 May 2017 (or in August/September 2017), because it might kill your whole family.

title: Prayer Request: Darkhorse Marine Battalion
subtitle: A prayer request for the Darkhorse Marine battalion fighting in Afghanistan is several years old.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: Prayers are requested for the Darkhorse Marine battalion fighting in Afghanistan.

title: Greg Comer Prayer Request
subtitle: The lack of dates in prayer chains often causes confusion about the validity of such messages.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Prayers are requested for Greg Comer, a North Carolina man who is battling cancer.

title: Text 'Hunger' to 35350 to Donate to Local Food Banks?
subtitle: Texting the word 'HUNGER' to 35350 will no longer prompt Sam's Club to donate the equivalent 12 meals to a local food bank no longer works; you have to text 'MEALS' to that number.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: Texting the word 'HUNGER' to 35350 will cause Sam's Club to donate the monetary equivalent of 12 meals to a local food bank.

title: Is the Supreme Court Deciding Whether to Nullify the 2016 Election?
subtitle: A petition challenging the 2016 U.S. presidential election results has long since died on the vine without being taken up by the Supreme Court.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: The U.S. Supreme Court is deliberating a petition seeking to overturn the results of the 2016 presidential election due to purported Russian interference.

title: Is Everyone Who Bought Milk Since 2003 Covered Under a Class Action Settlement?
subtitle: The deadline to qualify for a class action settlement covering people who bought milk has long since passed.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: Anyone who bought milk after 2003 can be compensated under the terms of a class action lawsuit.

title: OUTDATED MISSING CHILD ALERT: Young Boy Kidnapped in Pennsylvania
subtitle: The boy pictured in a missing child appeal circulating on Facebook was actually abducted and found safe back in March 2016.
author: Arturo Garcia
statement: A 7-year-old boy is missing after being kidnapped from his home in Harrisburg, Pennsylvania.

title: Texas No Longer Issuing Birth Certificates to Babies Born to Undocumented Immigrants?
subtitle: A since-settled controversy over undocumented immigrants and birth certificates in Texas was shared as new after the November 2016 election.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: The State of Texas announced it would no longer be issuing birth certificates to the children of undocumented immigrants.

title: Did the Bureau of Land Management Vote to Slaughter 44,000 Wild Horses?
subtitle: Although an advisory board recommended it, the U.S. Bureau of Land Management (BLM) did not vote to euthanize 44,000 wild horses,
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: The U.S. Bureau of Land Management (BLM) has voted to euthanize 44,000 wild horses.

title: Missing Child: Rosemary Gullett
subtitle: Formerly missing teen Rosemary Gullet is no longer the subject of an active search.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: A 15-year-old girl named Rosemary Gullett is missing from her Portland, Oregon, home.

title: Did Johnson and Johnson Admit Their Baby Products Contain Cancer-Causing Formaldehyde?
subtitle: Johnson & Johnson reformulated their shampoo to remove formaldehyde, but that process was completed years ago and was based on consumers' unrealistic fears of chemicals.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: Johnson & Johnson "admitted" that their brand baby products contain formaldehyde, which is a known carcinogen.

title: Walter Reed Bible Ban
subtitle: Rumor: Walter Reed Medical Center has issued guidelines that prohibit the distribution of religious items during visits with patients.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: Walter Reed Medical Center guidelines prohibit the use or distribution of religious items during visits with patients.

title: Should You Put Your Hands at the 10 and 2 O'Clock Positions on the Steering Wheel?
subtitle: The times, they are a-changin'.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: To enhance maximum driving safety, motorists should keep their hands at the 10 and 2 o'clock positions on the steering wheel.

title: Is the Western Black Rhino Extinct?
subtitle: A species of rhinoceros has been repeatedly declared extinct since at least 2006.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: Conservationists recently announced that the western black rhino has become extinct.

title: Think Before You Donate!
subtitle: An article that compares the salaries of top executives of several large charitable organizations is mostly outdated and inaccurate.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: An Article accurately compares the salaries of top executives of several large charitable organizations.

title: Sick Child Christmas Card Request
subtitle: It's hard to believe that so much good will and fine intentions could wreak havoc, but they have. And they still are.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: A child dying of cancer wants you to send him or her cards so they can get into the Guinness World Book of Records.

title: Missing Child: Devon Ward
subtitle: A 14-year-old boy named Devon Ward who went missing from his Horseheads, New York, home has been found safe.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: A 14-year-old boy named Devon Ward is missing from his Horseheads, New York, home.

title: Are Virginia Voting Machines Rigged to Party-Switch Votes?
subtitle: Some Virginia voters experienced difficulties with miscalibrated touch-screen voting machines in 2014.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: Voting machines in Virginia have been "rigged" to switch votes for Republican candidates to Democratic candidates.

title: Komen Research and CEO Salary
subtitle: Online criticism claims the Susan G. Komen breast cancer organization only gives 20% of their donations to cancer research and pays their CEO $684,000 per year.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: The Susan G. Komen breast cancer organization gives only 20% of their donations to cancer research and pays their CEO $684,000 per year.

title: Holiday Mail for Heroes
subtitle: Can Americans send holiday cards to service members and veterans through a Red Cross-sponsored program?
author: David Mikkelson
statement: Americans can send holiday cards to service members and veterans through the "Holiday Mail for Heroes" program.

title: Christopher Hamrick Prayer Chain
subtitle: A viral Facebook post called for prayers for young Christopher Hamrick, who was injured in a car accident in 2012.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: Prayers are needed for Christopher Hamrick, who was injured in a car accident in 2012.

title: 'Undercover Colors': A Rape Drug-Detecting Nail Polish
subtitle: The idea for a nail polish that could help detect the presence of date-rape drugs in drinks morphed into a different form of product.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: Students have developed a nail polish called "Undercover Colors" that can detect the presence of drugs linked to date rape.

title: Are Chicken Jerky Treats From China Causing Illness in Pets?
subtitle: The U.S. Food and Drug Administration issued a number of warnings to American pet owners in the early 2010s.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: Chicken jerky treats from China are causing illness in pets.

title: Has Meat from Diseased Animals Been Approved for Consumers?
subtitle: A disturbing photograph supposedly documents a recent move to approve animal carcasses with cancers, tumors, and open sores for human consumption.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: New federal regulations are reclassifying as safe for human consumption meat from animal carcasses containing cancers, tumors, and open sores.

title: 809 Area Code Call Warning
subtitle: Scam alert warns that phone users lured into placing calls to the 809 area code are charged exorbitant long-distance fees.
author: Snopes Staff
statement: Unsuspecting phone customers are gulled into placing calls to area codes in the Caribbean that result in hefty charges.

title: Andy's Coming!
subtitle: Will shouting 'Andy's coming!' to Toy Story characters at Disney theme parks cause them to stop and drop?
author: David Mikkelson
statement: Shouting "Andy's coming!" to Toy Story characters at Disney theme parks will cause them to stop and drop.

title: Do 52 Thoroughbred Horses Need New Homes to Escape Slaughter?
subtitle: A plea that 52 thoroughbred horses are destined for slaughter if adopters are not found for them soon is long out-of-date.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: 52 thoroughbred horses are destined for slaughter if adopters are not found for them soon.

title: 'Hallmark Postcard from a Family Member' Virus
subtitle: Information about the 'Hallmark Postcard from a Family Member' computer virus.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: "You've Received a (Hallmark) Postcard from a Family Member!" e-mails harbor a dangerous virus.

title: Cards for Recovering Soldiers
subtitle: Walter Reed Hospital no longer accepts Christmas cards addressed to 'A Recovering American Soldier.'  Alternate programs have been established for sending holiday greetings to hospitalized service members.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: Walter Reed Hospital will accept Christmas cards addressed to "A Recovering American Soldier."

title: Did Tyrone Woodfork Beat an Elderly Oklahoma Couple?
subtitle: Woodfork, 22, was sentenced to consecutive life sentences on separate counts of felony murder, assault and battery with a dangerous weapon, and two counts of first-degree rape.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: Bob and Nancy Strait, an eldery Tulsa, Oklahoma, couple, were beaten and robbed in their home by Tyrone Woodfork.

title: 'Koobface' Virus Warning
subtitle: Warnings about a 'Koobface virus' spreading via Facebook are several years out of date,
author: David Mikkelson
statement: A trojan worm known as Koobface is "spreading like wildfire" via Facebook.

title: Does the Owner of Progressive Insurance 'Donate Millions to the ACLU'?
subtitle: Progressive's former CEO, Peter Lewis, personally donated to liberal political causes, but he's been dead for years.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: Progressive Insurance chairman Peter Lewis has donated millions of dollars to the ACLU and liberal political causes.

title: Are Buddhist Extremists in India Burning Churches?
subtitle: A viral message warned that Buddhist extremists in India planned to burn down 200 churches and kill 200 missionaries within 24 hours.
author: Snopes Staff
statement: Buddhist extremists in India plan to burn down 200 churches and kill 200 missionaries within 24 hours.

title: Is FOX News Airing a Revealing Documentary on Barack Obama?
subtitle: "The report has uncovered more of Obama's radical past and we will see things that no one in the media is willing to put out there."
author: David Mikkelson
statement: FOX News will soon be airing a revealing documentary about Barack Obama.

title: Does Facebook's Policy Allow Them to Use Your Photos in Ads?
subtitle: Rumors have circulated for many years saying that all your photos are up for grabs.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: A new Facebook policy allows advertisers to use members' pictures without permission.

title: Home Depot and the Federal Government
subtitle: Is the Home Depot chain of stores declining to do business with the federal government?
author: David Mikkelson
statement: The Home Depot chain of stores is declining to do business with the federal government.

title: Do Walmart Flip-Flops Cause Chemical Burns?
subtitle: "Many products coming out of China are now being recalled due to unsafe materials to make products and keep the budget at a low cost."
author: Snopes Staff
statement: Walmart halted sales of Chinese-made flip-flops after some purchasers reported suffering skin rashes or chemical burns.

title: Are These the True Costs of Immigrants in Los Angeles?
subtitle: Misleading statistics about the number and costs of undocumented immigrants in Los Angeles County have been circulating online for 14 years.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: A listing provides accurate statistics about the number and costs of undocumented immigrants in Los Angeles County.

title: Do American Atheists Oppose the Ground Zero Cross?
subtitle: "This is a Christian religious advertisement, and allowing it to stay there is an insult to everyone who doesn't believe in that particular religion."
author: David Mikkelson
statement: American Atheists are opposing the incorporation of a steel-beam cross found in the World Trade Center rubble into a September 11 memorial and museum.

title: Jacqueline Saburido Medical Appeal
subtitle: Jacqui Saburido, the victim of a drunk driving accident, sought donations to help with the medical treatment for her extensive injuries.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: Jacqueline Saburido, the victim of a drunk driving accident, seeks donations to help with the expenses of medical treatment for her extensive injuries.

title: What's a Military Family Worth?
subtitle: A comparison of compensation paid to September 11 victims and service members killed on active duty cites old figures.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: Article contrasts compensation paid to families of September 11 victims with benefits paid to families of U.S. military personnel killed on active duty.

title: WIll a NYC Firefighter Memorial Be Historically Inaccurate?
subtitle: Has a memorial to New York City firefighters has been rendered in a historically inaccurate way?
author: Snopes Staff
statement: A memorial to New York City firefighters will be rendered in a historically inaccurate way.

title: Murder of Jamie Bulger
subtitle: An outdated petition decries the true and horrific death of Jamie Bulger at the hands of Jon Venables and Robert Thompson.
author: Snopes Staff
statement: Two British teens who killed a child when they were ten years old were granted anonymity for life by the courts and released from custody in June 2001.

title: Prayer Request: Child Shot by Nail Gun
subtitle: A prayer request about a 22-month-old child who shot himself in the heart with a nail gun is ten years old.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: Prayers are requested for a 22-month-old boy who accidentally shot himself with a nail gun.
